summary_en: The paragraph uses 1 Cor 2:6 (“among the perfect/mature”) to argue that Paul’s gospel has a distinctly theological, cognitive character for all believers, even though he does articulate a deeper “wisdom” for the mature. Terms like gnosis/epignosis can denote advanced understanding for the mature, yet they also describe the common knowledge of the gospel. Paul teaches with ordered method and views the gospel as objective truth requiring enlightened understanding; this unified knowledge centers on God and Christ. Thus, 1 Cor 2:6 does not imply an esoteric, separate theology for an elite, but a deeper level within the same coherent system.

summary_en: The phrase in 1 Cor 11:24, “This is my body for you” (huper humon), signals sacrificial surrender on behalf of believers. Thus Paul understands the Supper not merely as a rite of covenant fellowship but as an atoning rite that introduces into the new covenant because it atones. Together with “the new covenant in my blood” (v.25) and Passover imagery (1 Cor 5:7), Christ’s death is presented as removing the guilt of sin (objective) and grounding believers’ purity (subjective).
summary_zh: 林前11:24中的“这是我的身体，为你们（ὑπὲρ ὑμῶν）”表明基督为信徒所献的牺牲性舍命。因此，保罗将主餐理解为不但引入新约团契，更首先是赎罪的礼仪；正因赎罪，才引入新约。配合“这杯是用我血所立的新约”（11:25）与逾越节意象（林前5:7），基督之死既除去罪咎（客观层面），也成为信徒圣洁生活的根基（主观层面）。
